alert.note: Alert for Clay (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 1:37PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clay County through 215 PM CDT... At 137 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pocahontas, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Corning, Chalk Bluff Natural Area, Reyno, Knobel, McDougal, Success, Datto, Heelstring, Brookings, Twin Oaks, Palatka and Hickoria. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and southeastern Missouri.
